FacilityName: Giumarra Vineyards, Packing and Cold Storage

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Executive Summary



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:

- Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Giumarra Cold Storage has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1 Giumarra Cold Storage, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Giumarra Cold Storage has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities:

 

Process Name           | Process Chemical           | Process Quantity(lbs.)

P3 - North System        Anhydrous Ammonia            28,000

P4 - South System        Anhydrous Ammonia            54,000



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.



Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 

1. Prepared a unif

ied program based on the PSM regulation to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices

3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.



1.2 Process Descriptions



Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage operates a commercial cold storage for table grapes in Bakersfield, CA. The facility has two ammonia refrigeration systems that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:

Process 3: North system

(8) Storage rooms



Process 4: South system

(11) Precool rooms

(9) Storage rooms

(1) Inspection room



Most refrigerated spaces are equipped with air-cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operation. Storage room 11 and 12 are equipped with water-cooling evaporators as required for flooded operation. Precool rooms 3, 6, and 7 are equipped with air-cooling evaporators as required for pumped overfeed (recirculated) system.

The control valve groups are located on the roof or alongside the cold storage buildings. The refrigeration machinery is contained within or directly adjacent to or above each machinery room. A partial list of system components includes:

The flooded system operates as follows: high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped to each cold room, where it passes through an expansion valve into low temperature and pressure accumulator mounted behind the bunker wall or on the roof. From the accumulators, low pressure liquid is circulated through evaporator coils. As heat is absorbed, the liquid ammonia evaporates to form low temperature and pressure gas which is returned to the accumulator vessels. The suction gas is returned from the accumulators through a suction return line to the main suction accumulator.  From the main suction accumulator, ammonia is piped to the suction inlet on the compressors. The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to water-cooled evaporative condensers where the high pressure gas ammonia is cooled, liquefied and returned to each high pressure receiver.



The pumped overfeed system operates as follows:  high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped through a series of liquid feed solenoid valves, an expansion valve, and into a liquid recirculator.  From there, low pressure liquid is pumped to each evaporator, where it passes through a solenoid valve, hand expansion valve and into evaporator.  Low temperature liquid circulates through the evaporator.  As heat is absorbed, the liquid ammonia evaporates to form low temperature and pressure gas which passes through an isolation valve and is returned to the liquid recirculator.  The residual liquid is separate

d from the gas in the recirculator and the gas is piped to the suction inlet on the compressors which elevate the temperature and pressure of the gas.  The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to a water cooled evaporative condenser where the high pressure gas ammonia is liquefied and returned to each high pressure receiver.

The system contains numerous safety devices including sensors which stop the compressors if temperatures or pressures exceed or drop below established limits, and pressure relief valves which vent to the atmosphere or the ammonia diffuser tank if the pressure in the system exceeds their set point. 



An ammonia sampling system is installed in each refrigerated area and machinery room (north system only) that provides two-minute interval monitoring. The sampling system is set at the California OSHA permissible exposure limit of 25 ppm, which will activate an audible alarm.



An emergency control box is installed below Condenser 4 (south system) and on the north exterior wall of the north machinery room (north system). Each box contains three valves. The high and low side of the system each have a valve that would discharge to atmosphere. The connecting pipe between the high and low side has one equalizer valve that would equalize the system.



The ammonia refrigeration systems at Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are not interconnected by piping.  As such, each refrigeration system at Giumarra Vineyards Cold Storage is treated as a separate process.



1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



1.3.1 General 



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



Giumarra Cold Storage has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-ca

se and alternative release scenarios for a process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders.

 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia



a process at the Giumarra Cold Storage facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor a process and keep records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. 



1.3.3 Sulfur-Dioxide

The sulfur-dioxide process at the Giumarra Cold Storage facility is an integral part of overall business and lasts for approximately five months out of the year. It is extremely important that these areas and associated injection processes are maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Giumarra Cold Storage is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of exposure to sulfur-dioxide.



Our personnel also monitor the sulfur-dioxide fumigation process and keep an active log of all associated procedures and transactions. In addition, the process is checked frequently during the season by the outside contractor that supplies the SO2 cylinders. The contractor also assists in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our process equipment. 



1.4 Five Year Accident History



Giumarra Cold Storage has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.



1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan



Giumarra Cold Storage's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:

- California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

- F

ederal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38



Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Giumarra Cold Storage has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Giumarra Cold Storage continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Giumarra Cold Storage's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Giumarra Cold Storage's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Giumarra Cold Storage has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Giumarra Cold Storage has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.



For the future, Giumarra Cold Storage now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive fr

amework that guides safe action for Giumarra Cold Storage employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Giumarra Cold Storage will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
